boardgame.name: Crusader (Volume 6, Issue 23 - Nov 2010)
The Crusader (Volume 6, Issue 23 - Nov 2010)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb
Feature Articles
Alea Iacta Est: The Continuation of a three part article. Iron Guts, Adventure for Mid-level Characters. We take a look at what it takes to run mid-level adventures, how to balance growing power with monster abilities.

20 Questions Thrown at Mark Allen! Artist Mark Allen does his best to answer the most pointless questions he’s ever been asked!

It's a Trap by Casey Cannfield. A new look at the whys and wherefores of traps.

Special Features
Fiction Aihrdian Chronicles, Being the 21st Narrative: Upon the shores at last to begin the final legs of their journey to the Twilight Wood.

New Monsters or Treasures
Monsters of Aihrde: Demons & Devils Come to Castles & Crusade. Samples from the Monsters & Treasure of Aihrde.

Look for new adventures, additives, and all manner of expansions for your table top role playing game. With guest authors such as Casey Cannfield, Mike Stewart, Christina Stiles, Kieth Hackwood and more.

Also In This Issue
Crystal Crypt Adventure!
Angry Gamer: An angry rant for the gamer in all of us.
Travels with the Troll Lord: Davis in JAIL!
Troll Freebies: Maps for your adventuring needs.
Cartoons by Peter Bradley!

boardgame.name: Crusader (Volume 6, Issue 25 - Oct 2011)
The Crusader (Volume 6, Issue 25 - Oct 2011)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

Alea iacta est! The Die is Cast!

The Crusader Journal is undergoing a slow metamorphosis. While continuing our focus on Castles & Crusades we are branching out into a more main stream of popular culture. Its not more additives for one game system or the other, rather Crusader is looking at all those things that draw us together as a culture, from the movies we watch to the books we read, the technology that drives us and the pastimes that occupy our free space. Join us for the latest issue of Crusader.

We welcome Jonathan Murdock to the pages of Crusader! His webcomic, now in print!

IN THIS ISSUE
• Alea Iacta Est: Gen Con 2011 Wrap Up (a little Troll Con and Origins to boot)- Steve takes a look back at this year's conventions; from top to bottom.

• The Pankratiast; Western Style Monks for you C&C game. Eric Piper takes an in depth look at the monk, retooling the class to fit a more westernized version.

• Historical Footnotes: Weapons of Mesopotamia. Joseph Wolz had a look at the main armaments of the Mesopotamian warriors!

• Stairway of the Gods a C&C Adventure. Another jaw dropping adventure by John Wright. Its quick and bloody, the road to the Gods!

• Dropping Into Adventure: Unusual Approaches to Dungeon Crawls. Gerald Buldak joins us this issue with a new approach to a pillar of the games we love to play.

And MORE
• Gods of Aihrde: Moridain, The Cobbler
• Rings of Brass: The Lothian Chronicles.
• Monster Ecology: The Chimera
• Comics with Peter Bradley & Marvin Breig and Jonathan Murdock
• Movie Quotes, Recipes, Humor and more

boardgame.name: Pagoda
Pagode
塔雲軒
boardgame.description:
Pagoda is a two-player only game in which players compete to build multiple layers of up to six pagodas. Each player has five face-up and two face-down colored cards, and they use these cards to build colored pillars and levels of the pagoda. Once a pillar has been placed on the ground floor, all other pillars placed must be of the same color. When someone places the fourth pillar on a level, he places a floor tile of the pillars' color on top, with this tile have colored dots to indicate which color of pillar can be placed on top.

Players score points each time they place a pillar, with a pillar on ground level being worth one point, a pillar on the second floor two points, and so on. When a player places a floor tile, he gains one point as well as two actions associated with that color on his individual action board. The fourth floor tile is placed upside-down to show only one colored dot. Two pillars can be placed on this dot, each worth five points, and once placed the pagoda is finished. After three pagodas are finished, players finish the round, then the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Time's Up! Family
Time's Up! Family 2
boardgame.description:
Time's Up! Family is a charades-based party game for teams of two or more players (and is best with teams of two). Before the game begins, each player looks at several cards featuring well-known items, crafts and animals and chooses some of them. Each player's cards and shuffled to form a deck, and this deck is used for each of the game's three rounds.

In each round, team members take turns trying to get their teammates to guess as many words and phrases on the cards as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed, and the cluegiver cannot pass on a card. In round 2, no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted); the cluegiver can pass on any card he likes, and the teammates can give only a single answer. In round 3, the cluegiver can use no words at all and can pass as often as he likes; again, teammates are allowed only a single guess. Give good physical clues in round 1, and they'll pay dividends down the road when you need to keep your mouth shut and gesture like a maniac before time's up!

Time's Up! Family 2 has 440 new words.

boardgame.name: Gaia Breaker
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Gaia Breaker is a retro-style vertical shooting game using the "enchant.js" Game Engine. The player controls a ship that has to shoot down all enemies entering the screen. Holding down the shoot button will put a focus on all enemies directly above the own ship, and releasing the button sends away a homing missile.

The WiiU release can be played on the TVscreen or the GamePad which can be held vertically.

boardgame.name: Der 7bte Zwerg
The 7th Dwarf
小矮人七仔
boardgame.description: Der 7bte Zwerg is a dice game released with a movie license. Players need to line up the seven dice — one each for the seven main characters in the film — in order by size, but this is easier said than done, so you'll need to take chances to do this while others bet for or against your success.

boardgame.name: MindMaze: Crime Stories
MindMaze: Historias policíacas
MindMaze: Verzwickte Rätsel – Kriminalfälle
Takie Życie 3: Tajemnice
boardgame.description:
In MindMaze: Verzwickte Rätsel - Kriminalfälle, players take turns asking questions to try to solve criminal mysteries.

In general, a referee tells a strange story, then the players must determine why and how the story happened by asking "Yes" or "No" questions, with "Not Important" also being a plausible answer. Players take turns asking questions, with a point being subtracted for each question. Players are awarded points for asking certain key questions that eliminate faux versions of the story. The list of useful key questions is attached to every riddle. This sort of gaming procedure effectively encourages players to develop careful analytical questions and eliminates random questions.

boardgame.name: Door Kickers
boardgame.description:
Door Kickers is an innovative Real-Time Tactics game that puts you in charge of a SWAT team. With your help we can make this The Ultimate Swat Team Command Simulator.

Analyze the situation, plan team routes, choose equipment and breach points and coordinate multiple troopers to reach the hostage room before the bad guys get to press that trigger.

It may sound daunting, and like real world CQB combat, it sure is. But most levels can be completed in minutes and on the fly improvisation works. Achieving the perfect planning, getting the mission done with no false steps, that’s a skill harder to master.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Banner Saga
boardgame.description:
The Banner Saga is an epic role-playing game inspired by Viking legend. Hand-painted landscapes portray a world eerily suspended in perpetual twilight. Cities and towns begin to crumble into chaos. Heroes abandon their hearths and homes to traverse the snowy countryside, gaining allies along the way to help battle a strange, new threat.

Decisions have consequences; wise choices must be made when conversing with possible allies during intricately crafted dialogues. Turn-based strategy brings tactical challenge in hand-animated battle sequences. With visuals evocative of the golden age of animation, The Banner Saga brings skillfully crafted art, story and strategy to gamers waiting to re-experience classic adventures and tactics.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: MicroSport Shuffle
boardgame.description:
MicroSport Shuffle is a game of dexterity and skill based on popular British pub games dating back to the 15th Century.

On his turn, a player flicks four coins across a board marked with horizontal bands called beds. If a coin lands entirely within a bed (that is, without touching a horizontal line), he scores a point. Points are scored after each flick, so earlier coins may score multiple times, as long as they bumped into another bed. After his turn, the four coins are removed from the board and the game proceeds with the next player.

The object of the game is to score three points in each of the five beds. If a player lands a coin in a completed bed (where he already has three points), a point is awarded to his opponent instead. The winner is the first player to score fifteen points.

boardgame.name: Leben in Essen
boardgame.description:
A simple game published about the German City of Essen.
By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.
During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Essen. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

boardgame.name: Rogue Amongst the Peasants
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time, in 2 neighboring villages at war, 1 of the peasants was not like the others...He was sent to create havoc and take out as many of the enemy inhabitants as he could unnoticed.

One day, both villages caught on to the other's sinister plot, and the manhunt to expose the traitor began! And neither village will be at peace until either the enemy's residents, or the other's rogue, is destroyed!


Includes 2 8-card decks (5 Peasants, 2 Guards, 1 Rogue per player.).


The objective of this game is to expose the other player's Rogue card, or kill all of their Peasants, before they can do the same to you. Each turn, the players draw 3 cards and each choose 1 from the other player's hand before discarding and drawing another 3 cards. Should a Peasant be revealed, nothing happens. Should a Guard show his face, your opponent gets to reveal an additional card from your hand for that turn. Should the Rogue be revealed, you win. This was designed as a very quick, as well as easy to learn, mini-game.

One final mechanic worth mentioning: should a player have their Rogue card in hand and it is not revealed that turn, both decks and discard piles are reshuffled and their opponent removes one of their Peasants from their deck.

boardgame.description:
Clairvoyance is a game where you take on the identity of one of eight different psychics trying to prove who's the best by bludgeoning all the rest into unconsciousness. Each character has their own power to aid them in being the top local psychic by proving themselves most adept at levitating furniture into the others' faces.

Players turn a shared d-8 die to play cards from their hands, those cards being items or instants, flung at an opponent or placed on the table. Each player starts with 10 life, and the goal is to knock everyone else out with your telekinetically flung furniture as they attempt to prevent you from doing so by either changing the face of the die (the face being what is needed to activate a card) or by using their own items and instants.

boardgame.name: Invasion from Jupiter
Kim
Magic Square
Skittles
Super Programs 1
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Super Programs 1 (for 1K machines) was a compilation released for the ZX81. The programs were an eclectic mix of simple games and utilities:

1. Invasion from Jupiter - How many guardians of Jupiter's secret weapon can you exterminate?

The game shows a number of guards (asterisks) in front of the 'secret weapon'. By entering a number between 20 and 99 the user fires at the guards. Hitting 10 guards wins the game.

2. Skittles - Decide where to bowl six balls and try to knock over 30 skittles

The game displays 30 skittles and a ball. The ball can be moved up and down to select which row to bowl on.

3. Magic Square - Re-arrange the numbers in the magic square into a new pattern

The computer shows 15 numbers and a space in a square. The user can rearrange the numbers by selecting which number to move into the space. There is no defined goal to the game, other to create a different pattern.

4. Doodle - Draw your own computer assisted pictures

The computer generates a random start point. By using the arrow keys (keys 5-8 on the ZX81) and keys 1-4 for diagonals, the user can draw a line on screen to create a doodle.

5. Kim - Test your memory when the computer removes an item randomly from the screen

The computer displays 20 characters. After a short delay, they disappear, and then reappear with one missing. The user must remember and type the missing character.

6. Liquid Capacity (Litres) - Easy conversion between pints/gallons and litres

A simple conversion utility.

boardgame.name: Black Star
boardgame.description:
From the Inlay

The base of the Cosmic Guerillas, Black Star, a huge industrial complex lodged on an asteroid. Tracing down the complex had taken some time, you had to spend time recovering from your last mission in hospital while you grew a new arm an leg this had given you time to trace the Black Star Base and had also given time to have your Svlegian Raider rebuilt with some modifications.

And now you are hanging in space over the enormous complex of metal structures priming yourself for your run down the metal valley to bomb the main energy supply of the Black Star Base. Your hands glide knowledgably over the controls and your eyes scan over the instrument display. It is time.

You drop your Svlegian Raider down toward the Base, leaving your stomach about five kilometers behind, then you are suddenly surrounded by the walls of the base, walls bristling with technology. you fire on the energy ducts which fly past at incredible speed, explosions mushroom around you and the rear scanner is showing following craft, your increase speed and fire at the ducts, dodging from side to side of the narrow corridor down which you are flying, the metal walls outside your craft disappear in a blur of speed and you are angling out of the metal valley, arcing up and over to bring yourself into position ready for the next run on the Black Star...

User Summary

Black Star was written by M. Sudworth and released by Quicksilva for the Sinclair ZX81.

The action is reminiscent of the climactic scene from Star Wars: A New Hope - the Death Star Trench Run.

The player pilots a ship into the screen, which depicts a 3D trench. The player can speed up or slow down the ship. Flying faster will take you over more of the targets before the time-limit expires, offering you a chance for a higher score, but of course makes them harder to hit with your limited supply of bombs. In addition, going faster depletes your fuel more quickly, so you may run out of fuel before the timer runs out.

boardgame.name: Grand Tactics: Rise of Novice
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter page:

"Every three years, in the prosperous city of Matilda, an event is held in which the lord of the city will choose the finest and bravest warriors to join the ranks of the Matilda Defenders. This battle tournament tests the team's tactics and strategies to convince the lord and to show the citizens which team is worthy to be part of the renowned Matilda Defenders."

Inspired by a number of tactical games played over the course of our gaming years, including: Tactics Ogre, Front Mission 3, Rhapsody, Disgaea, Vandal Hearts, Vanguard Bandits, and lastly, the game that inspired us the most, Final Fantasy Tactics.

Kill all enemies - the word says it all, simply wipe out all enemies on the battlefield. Protect your leader and defeat the opposing side leader.

boardgame.description:
As the leader of your Viking clan, your goal is to earn the most honor in all of Dragonia. But beware, wild dragons and rival clans will engage you in battle, stealing your honor and preventing you from collecting treasures.

Vikings of Dragonia is a 2-5 player game of strategy, risk, and reward. Your goal is to become the next ruler of Dragonia by being the first to have the most honor of all. On a modular board and deck of power cards, players choose from a wide selection of options on their turn to expand their territory, increase their honor, or engage in battles with rival clans.

Will you be the next ruler of Dragonia?

boardgame.name: Tralalaa
boardgame.description:
At the beginning of the game, each player secretly receives a team card. They don't know who will be their partner, so they'll have to judge everyone fairly.
At the beginning of the round, each player gets 7 cards with a piece of lyrics on them. They proceed to draft all the cards until they receive one last from their neighbor. Then, they all try to compose a short song with 5 of their cards. They can choose to use the lyrics, or to flip the card over to the "Tralalaa" card instead. When everyone is ready, players take turns singing the song they just wrote (humming, shouting or beatboxing on each card on the "Tralalaa" face), with the tune and musical genre of their choice. After each performance, other players each award one point or zero to the player who just sang. But don't be to harsh: remember, anyone can be on your team!

boardgame.name: Adventure Fantasy Game (8th Revision)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original Old School Fantasy game.

New School Game Mechanics, Old School Adventure Game.

Simple, d6-based game mechanics. Characters improve by Plundering, completing Accomplishments, or by actually trying to do stuff.

No clerics, no XPs, memorization or other legacy rules, no accounting, but still compatible with Old School material without conversion.

5MORE Resolution System, skills improving with use.

Relaxed multiclassing and character growth.

Two combat systems:

5MAIL: quick and easy
FIGHTMORE: combat as melee challenges, armour reduces damage.


Meaningful religions and worship rules. Enough with clerics!

Mana-based system and more than 90 new spells. Enough with vancian magic!

Campaign creation: Accomplishments, Holdings and MOSTROTRON, a monster generator.

Contains also a 15 pages introductory adventure "The Temple Beneath the Harga Volcano", a self-contained sandbox setting. It features cannibals, terrorscarabs, exploration, a marginally active volcano, inhospitable locals, glaciers, a giant or two and heads on sticks.

And Squid Templars of Cthulhu.

Plays quick and easy, like it should.

boardgame.name: Dominaedro
boardgame.description:
Dominaedro is a abstract game played with 9 d12 dice, pieces of dominoes and some counters.

Players roll the d12 dice to create a 3x3 grid. Then they pick 3 dominoes pieces, and on their turn they put one piece between the dice, following placement rules. Players try to make the best combinations to get the most points.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points is the winner.

Agravaine’s Rest is the unlikely name for a haven of half-orcs and orcs, set at the mouth of a remote mountain pass. Flanked by steep cliffs and all but impenetrable mountains the Rest’s strategic location has brought both wealth and danger to its inhabitants.

Built around the crypt of a famed paladin crusader, the shadows lurking in the way station’s past, and the secrets prowling its doorstep, could lead to the downfall of this wilderness fortress. A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game GM’s Resource supplement by Greg Marks

Hard Bay’s fate has ever been tied to the sea. Although blessed with a natural, protected harbour and plentiful fishing, foul weather and a dangerous, unwholesome reputation have conspired to keep the village nothing more than a dreary, isolated place. boardgame.name: Post-Apocalyptic Blues Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Post-Apocalyptic Blues takes place fifty years after World War III in the city of New Orleans, or Nola as it is called by the locals. Ruled over by the enigmatic Baron Samedi, New Orleans struggles to rebuild while defending itself from slavers, raiders, internal tribal squabbles, and an angry environment that has been trying to swallow it whole long before the first bombs fell.

Designed for use with Modern OGL game systems, Post-Apocalyptic Blues throws players into the heart of New Orleans just as civilization begins the slow, painful process of returning after a nuclear war.

This sourcebook includes everything the player needs to survive, including:

Nine custom classes specifically designed to survive in the Post-Apocalyptic wastes (Doctor, Engineer, Historian, Hunter, Mercenary, Occultist, Scavenger, Survivalist, and Tribal)
Redesigned skills and feats to provide much needed flexibility to characters struggling for survival, including a new group of feats (Mutations) to ensure survival of the fittest.
A magic system reimagined specifically for the flavor of New Orleans' occult history.
Rules for cybernetics, implants, and robots.
Detailed information on the various factions vying for control of the region.
Overview of each of the parishes of New Orleans and the surrounding area.
Three Full color maps to help navigate the dangerous terrain.
Alternate rules for Group Feats to encourage cooperation and reward roleplaying.


Special Note: The GM Edition includes all important NPC stat blocks, new creature templates, and nine new creatures. The Player's Guide does not include these features.

boardgame.name: Gold West
boardgame.description:
In Gold West, players compete as prospectors building their mining empires while vying over the precious metals of the frontier. In a delicate balance of resource management and area control, players must plan their building strategies while carefully managing their supply tracks to refine the right resources at the most opportune times. Stay a step ahead of the competition and you could lead the West into the Golden Age.

The goal of Gold West is to accumulate the most victory points through clever management of your growing mining empire. There are five resources in the game: the metals Copper, Silver, and Gold are used to acquire victory points in a variety of ways, while Timber and Stone are building materials used to build camps and settlements on the board to collect more resources and influence the landscape.

Each hex contains either two or three resources. Gold generally earns players the most points, with silver and copper yielding slightly less. In addition, each terrain type scores points for the player with the most influence therein at the end of the game. Copper terrains are the most valuable, with Silver, Gold, and Forest Terrains earning slightly fewer points.

When gaining new metals and materials, players place them in their "supply track", a mancala-style track in which you will manage your resources. You get points the further back in the track you place them, as this creates a more refined product, but it will take longer to get these resources to the front of the supply track where they can be used. Shipping, investments, and Boomtown offices often reward players who fulfill them earlier, so it's a careful balance of risk and reward.

boardgame.name: Stratagem
boardgame.description:
Light and fun, Stratagem is an abstract strategy board game strikes a perfect balance of luck and strategy that casual gamers will really enjoy.

This turn-based game can be played with 2 to 6 players. Players take turns rolling a die for movement and claiming spaces on a hexagonal board. When claimed spaced are converted to controlled spaces players score points. The first player to reach a target score wins.

Action cards can be played to support or hinder any player's progress. On each player's turns all players have an opportunity to play one card if they want to.

Not to be confused with:

Stratagem (1998)
StrataGem (2004)

boardgame.name: Pioneers
boardgame.description:
Pioneers is a thematic card game inspired by the old video game Oregon Trail. You play as a pioneer crossing the United States in the 1830's. You gather supplies, play action cards, and encounter events that can help you along, or hinder your travels. The goal is to get to the west coast first by spending resources to travel to cities. You will be collecting supply cards, surviving events, and interacting with other players.

Gameplay: Every player starts the game with a party leader card that grants special abilities along with 3 party members. If all 3 party members die, you lose and the game continues. In the center of the table are destination decks that every player is trying to travel to. To travel to a destination, you spend the required resources shown, acquire the card, and move on to the next destination. The player that gets the set of 2 rivers, and 3 cities, ends the game and wins after a final round if no other players collect all their destinations. Your party size is used as a tiebreaker if needed.
Each player turn consists of drawing cards, playing actions (on themselves or other players), traveling to a destination, and discarding cards.

boardgame.name: Parquet
boardgame.description:
2-player abstract strategy board game of movement, sliding and stacking ... that will floor you!

OBJECT: stack three own-colour pieces on the rear-rank corner tile of the opponent. The first player to do so, is the winner.

PLAY: players alternately either move or leap one piece at a time to an unoccupied tile then slide an unoccupied tile to an adjacent void or, slide an unoccupied tile to an adjacent void then move or leap a piece. A piece may not move onto or leap over a void. Players may not slide (return) a tile to the void created immediately previous. A player unable to move / leap a piece or slide a tile, forfeits the turn.

boardgame.name: BA-KAR-EE
boardgame.description:
Rare card game that uses standard playing cards with the addition of 8 Royal Aces and eight Jokers. As there are two packs, this makes a total of 120 cards per game.

The game is a curious mix of Rummy and Whist. Each player gets 18 cards dealt to them. There now begins a phase of drawing and discarding until a player lays down a run or set of 5 cards (5 Nines or a run of five, for example). Bonuses and penalties are then scored and every player must reduce their hand to 13 cards.

Then the auction begins and one player (or team if playing partnerships) will win the auction and then need to make that many tricks as bid. Card play is exactly the same as standard games like Whist. Royal Aces secured in this phase (or Release) score sizeable bonus points.

It can be seen that strategy is needed at every phase. If you use a high scoring 5 cards in the first stage (known as Release), the cards used will not be available to you for the auction and card-play in the 2nd phase.

The object is to be the first player (or partnership) to score 1,000 points.

boardgame.name: Maidania
boardgame.description:
2-players strategy game MAIDANIA: “UA for EU vs. Dictator”

This “revolutionary-intellectual“ game is dedicated to the so called „Euromaidan“, pro-European Union protests in Ukraine these days.
The patriots struggle in Maidans in Kyiv and in other Ukrainian cities against the riot police "Berkut"– for justice and democracy.
One player plays for all "berkuts" and other plays for all protesters.

You can play for the leaders of Ukrainian opposition (Yulia Tymoshenko, Vitaliy Klitschko and others) and also for “casual” Ukrainians: a doctor, a student, a driver, а worker etc.

The protesters try to reach crossword-like walls of the game board in order to place there their tents with the democratic and patriotic slogans: FREEDOM, DEMOCRACY etc.The “berkuts” try to make the protesters “silent” and “paralyzed” by jumping over them. Both "berkuts" and the protesters move in all directions but jump only vertically and horizontally.

boardgame.name: Tandenbeul
Tooth Terror
boardgame.description:
Tooth Terror is a hilarious 2-3 player card game in which you assume the role of a particularly nasty dentist. You score 'Pain points' by performing treatments. These vary from moderately (Drilling) to excruciatingly painful (Root Canal). Try to make your treatments as painful as possible in order to collect as much Pain points as possible.

To hinder your opponents, you play cards that make their treatments less painful (Anesthesia, Sterile equipment). Of course you can also make your own treatments more painful by playing cards like Blood loss.

The game ends when there are no more cards to draw from the shared deck. Everybody compares their points and whoever has inflicted the most pain upon his patients is the winner of Tooth Terror.

boardgame.name: 1914: Germany at War
boardgame.description:
On 28 June 1914, Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife were shot dead in Sarajevo, by Gavrilo Princip, member of the Black Hand, a political organization seeking for a merging of the Balkan area into a Greater Serbia or a Yugoslavia.

Austria-Hungary subsequently issued an ultimatum against Serbia. As the ultimatum was rejected, Austria-Hungary then declared war, marking the outbreak of the war.

While France and Russia immediately sided with Serbia, Germany joined the Austria-Hungary and started a surprise offensive in the west with the objective of quickly defeating the French, to then turn east and knock the Tzarist Russia out of the war.


1914 is a game of World War I conflict simulation at the strategic level. It recalls the most decisive battles fought by Germany on the Western Front in 1914. Although based on historical events and battles, the players in command of the two factions can modify the evolution of World War I.

The game is recommended for two or three players, but has a good solitaire suitability.

Developed with a system of wooden blocks and cubes and played out over a 64x86 cm multicolor mapboard, with more than 200 wooden components painted "A buratto", a technique usually adopted for painting car parts and accessories.

The rules are divided into two major sections which can be learned one at a time:

• The Game Rules introduce the basic concepts and enable players to start playing the game without too many rules to remember.
• The Optional Rules are for those who want to get the most out of the game, with rules for Surprise Attack, Retreat, Marne Offensive, British Fusiliers and more.

In 1914, 1 cm is approximately 27 km, a turn is 1 month long, and a full-strength counter represents a major military formation, normally corps size with some divisions.

The game must be played with "Fog of War" on (with the faces of wooden blocks hidden from the opponent).

boardgame.name: To Slay a Dragon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Holdenshire is a peaceful county. Ruled by Lord Pemberton, the villages of Hengistbury and Thornbury exist in a friendly rivalry.

Winter is over, and Hengistbury is experiencing a warm, dry Spring. The summer county fair is already being organized, the Fair Committee headed as always by Lady Sybill Pemberton, and the village is its usual bustling, cheerful self.

All is not well, however. There have been problems of late! Children have been disappearing into the Weirwood; howls of an unearthly nature have been echoing across the Fogmoor; and Three-Fingered Jake, the county’s itinerant bard, has been speading rumors of treasure and hauntings in the ruins of Brockendale Castle. And that’s not to mention the lizardmen aggression or the bandits upriver!

All this aside, however, tonight is a warm, balmy evening. Many of the villagers are gathered in and outside the Bleeding Heart Tavern (originally called the Beaming Hearth, until some children vandalized the pub’s sign), and any troubles seem far away.

Well, except for that dragon in Skull Mountain.

Do you remember D&D adventures which consisted solely of trekking to a dragon’s lair and slaying it, old-school style? Have you fond memories of the NIGHT BELOW boxed set – in particular the first book which details the area of Haranshire and the various goings-on there?

If you love the idea of a small village setting, detailed with various plot hooks and sub-quests, followed by a good-old fashioned hex-crawl and a dragon slaying, this adventure is for you! It’s NIGHT BELOW crossed with THE HOBBIT. Kinda.

It’s simple. It’s old-school. We’re not talking elaborate motivations, complex plots, or a dragon with a 12-page statblock and a lair which requires a degree to run well. We’re talking some sandboxy quests, a lengthy wilderness trek, a bit of a dungeon-crawl, then a straightforward, stand-up fight with a dragon. And lots and lots of treasure.

boardgame.name: A Bit Of Class: Bloodlines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bloodlines for sorcerers have proved to be one of the more popular additions to the game in its current incarnation. This ebook offers up 10 new sorcerer bloodlines for your game, including:

Aesthetic – An inwardly focused sorcerer whose abilities are powered by ki energy.
Alternate Reality – With ancestors from a parallel universe, this sorcerer can change the very laws of nature and magic.
Gremlin – The blood of fey tricksters allows this sorcerer to curse and cause general mischief and mayhem.
Insectoid – A hint of vermin blood gives this sorcerer insect-like abilities.
Quickling – Unprecedented speed and powers of concealment are the gifts of this bloodline.
Reincarnated – Access to many previous lives gives this sorcerer the ability to tap into the knowledge and powers of past versions of himself.
Slayer – The need to hunt down and kill an ancestral foe runs deep in this bloodline, along with the powers needed to accomplish their goals.
Telepath – The telepathic powers of this sorcerer make them excellent spies and information gatherers.
Unraveller – With the power to disrupt the spells and magic of other creatures, this bloodline offers a unique play experience.
Vampiric – Become a day-walker with many of the cool abilities of a vampire but none of the drawbacks.


A Bit Of Class: Bloodlines is a class ability sourcebook compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

boardgame.name: Nemesis Bestiary III
The Nemesis Bestiary Volume III
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Nemesis Bestiary series is an outgrowth of the Space Monsters series of PDFs for the Galaxy Command (D20 Future) setting. Like Space Monsters, the Nemesis Bestiary series takes an interesting piece of stock art and builds a new creature around the art, rather than commissioning art after the text is written. Space Monsters quickly built up a menagerie of fun, original aliens and Nemesis Bestiary Volume One begins the same process.

The Nemesis Bestiary takes a somewhat unusual approach to revealing a monster’s history and behavior. While game-rule information and special powers are clearly delinated, the monster’s history, true nature and motivations aren’t. Instead, reports from the field, written by adventurers who’ve survived an encounter with the beast give first-hand, though often fragmentary and sometimes contradictory, information. The rationale is that even if your players have read the statblocks for the new creatures in this PDF, they still don’t know everything about the monster. The game master is free to improvise, expand and extrapolate as desired to build a unique encounter around one of these powerful and intriguing new beasts.

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Highway Features is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Highway Features is a geomorphic set, comprising 6 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. Each component features a road surrounded by countryside/wilderness, and with a specific location or feel.

Cliffs - the road creeps between two escarpments, the ideal location for an ambush
Slump - the old road has fallen due to tremours - but what caused them?
Fallen Tree - an innocent victim of a storm, or placed by bandits to waylay travellers?
Toll Gate - Is the guard honest? Corrupt? Alive?
Bridge - who's that trip-trapping over my bridge?
Ford - can you escape your persuers by crossing the ford?


Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

boardgame.name: ROLF: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters (Old Skool Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

BACK FROM THE PAST TO HAUNT THE PRESENT....

Once upon a time, there were things things called newsgroups. They were kinda-sorta like Facebook and message forums, only without pictures and with even more rude people. They existed in the days when there were only four television networks and your parents had to walk up hill to and from school. AND THEY LIKED IT!

In some of these newsgroups, gamers, wanna-be game designers, and even honest-to-god real professional game designers would post rules and monsters and musings and writings of all sorts for their favorite games. Sometimes, entire game systems would appear.

Back in those ancient times in the summer of 1995, the first version of ROLF! was posted to one of those fabled newsgroups... rec.games.frp.misc.

Now, unearthed from the deepest recesses of the Interwebs--proving that whatever is on the web really is there forever--and converted to PDF, we proudly presents that historic game for your enjoyment.

(Supplements for the current edition of ROLF! are more or less compatible with this hoary original iteration, although some rules have changed... for the better, we like to think!)

boardgame.name: Icing Oetzi: A Historical Recreation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

On a Wednesday afternoon some 5,300 years ago, a shepherd headed into the Alps to tend his flock of goats. He would never see his home again. His mummified corpse and violent death have been the subject of study and speculation since a retreating glacier released him from his makeshift grave in 1991, A.D. (or C.E.... whatever.)

In observance of the 20th anniverary of the discovery of the victim now known as "Oetzi the Iceman," and in support of NUELOW Games' goal of educating while entertaining, we proudly present Icing Oetzi: A ROLF! Historical Recreation.

The result of all the research that can be expected for a $0.50 product from a company named NUELOW Games, the three combat scenarios and four pre-generated characters presented gives insight into a mystery that's more than 5,000 years old. Who killed Oetzi? The religions fanatic? The angry cook? Or the Tyrolean Yeti? Play the Recreations with friends, and decide which one rings true.

Also included, as a special bonus, is a major rules expansion for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters. The two pages of additional rules material present new Combat Maneuvers and Traits, as well as optional modifications to existing ones. Also featured are optional rules for Ranged Weapons and an optional modification to the character generation system.

boardgame.name: Bullets to the Head
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SUPERHEROES... THE ROLF! WAY!!

Husband and wife superhero team Bulletman and Bulletgirl are confronted with an impossible choice: When nefarious mad scientist Der Kopf kidnaps their son and threatens to kill him if they interfere with his plans, they must choose between rescuing him or saving Guardian City. What are loving parents who fight crime on the weekends to do?

Given that this is a supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters, they set out to kick the butt of Der Kopf and his Robots of Doom... Little Billy can probably take care of himself while kicking a little robot butt along the way, too.

"Bullets to the Head" brings a new dimension to ROLF! with new traits and combat maneuvers designed to emulate the straightforward, head-busting superheroes of the Golden Age of comics, as well as their goofy sidekicks. The supplement includes, among other things the game-changing Super Power trait and the crazy Walking Disaster Area combat manuever; statistics for six pre-generated characters; and four linked combat scenarios.

If you like having fun with superheroes and if you like taking ROLF! beyond what we offer up in these supplements by making your own characters, we think you'll love "Bullets to the Head."

Interesting Trivia: Bulletgirl was one of the first female heroes to appear in comic books, predating even Wonder Woman. She gained her initial powers by sneaking a dose of her future hussand's super-strength formula, because she wanted in on the action.

boardgame.name: Pick Nick!
boardgame.description:
In Pick Nick, each player has two or three insects that they want to move out of the garden to safety. Nick the bird, however, has other plans and will peck at exposed insects to send them scurrying back to the starting line.

To set up, players takes two insects for a short game and three for a longer game; place the leaves into their holders and set them next to the game board so that they cover certain spaces. On a turn, a player rolls the die, then adds one of his insects to the movement track. Once all of a player's insects are on the track, he moves any one of his choice on his turn based on the die roll. If he rolls Nick, he makes the bird pick up one of the insect tokens with his beak, ideally catching one of the opponents! That player must start over with that token. Whoever reaches the end of the track with all of his insects first wins.

boardgame.name: Old and Angry
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

NEVER MIND THE EXPENDABLES--HERE'S THE OLD AND ANGRY!

Once upon a time, they sent bad guys to prison, physical rehab, or the morgue. Harry Callahan. James Braddock, Robert Malone and his wife Barbara Gordon-Malone were forces for good who cut violent and bloody swaths through evil.

But that was a long time ago. For more than 20 years, they have been living quietly in the Shady Acres Retirement Community... but that peace is being disturbed by loud music, obnoxious protesters, and marauding muggers. Hip-Hop Enthusiasts, Occupy Movement Members, and other trouble-makers have invaded their happy home and are threatening the traquility of Bingo Night.

Now these aging champions of justice for the innocent are once again picking up their guns and pulling on their butt-kicking boots to show these punks how it was done in the old days.

ROLF!: Old and Angry features game stats for five classic action characters, and four other characters who are their friends to be protected or foes to be defeated in six Battle Scenarios. Also included are five never-before-presented Traits designed to let you make your own battle axes once you're done playing with the ones we've presented.

HARRY HAS THE MOST POWERFUL HANDGUN IN THE WORLD,
SO YOU KIDS BETTER STAY OFF HIS LAWN!

boardgame.name: The Mummy's Tune
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mummy's Tune: It's Sure to Knock Them Dead!

Shock-pop princess Lady GooGoo's latest outrageous stunt will see her performing a 4000-year-old song in the shadows of the Great Pyramids while wearing nothing but a few strips of bacon. The fact the song is reputed to level a deadly curse against anyone who isn't Pricess Ho-Baq, the original pop princess, makes this performance even more exciting for her and her fans. But there are deadly forces arrayed against her--the Muslim Brotherhood, Mummy Cultists, and even Ho-Baq herself.

The Mummy's Tune features four linked Battle Scenarios that combine to trace a bone-chilling storyline fit for a mummy movie from Hammer Films or, perhaps, The Asylum. It includes brand new Traits (Demure and Like An Egyptian), the most complex Spelling that has yet to be fatured in a ROLF! product, and an assortment of Combat Maneuvers not included in the core rulebook. Also included are stats for 13 pre-generated characters, including Mohamed Morsi and his Muslim Brotherhood Thugs, the legendary Prncess Ho-Baq, Egyptologist Lord Charles Wiffleton, and others.

boardgame.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Oldenburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Oldenburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.

From publisher blurb:

To Secure the Future, They Must Fight in the Past!

The Trouser Snakes, rebels from a dark future where only the rich wear pants, thought they had dealt a fatal blow to the plutocratic One World Government... but now they have learned their foes are sending an assassin back to the year 2013 to alter history. Brave rebels plunge through the mists of time to save their group before it was even founded--by saving the life of US politician and renowned sexting expert Anthony Weiner.

Rise of the Trouser Snakes 2: Whacking Weiner is a stand-alone sequel to the ROLF! cyberpunk adventure Rise of the Trouser Snakes. It features statistics for two new Trouser Snakes, the evil Time Killer, NYC Mayoral candidate Anthony Weiner.

boardgame.name: Climaxxx
Exxxcitation
Exxxtase
boardgame.description:
Climaxxx is a Roll and move erotic game for two players with similar mechanics to Snakes and Ladders. The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the end of the board. However, you lose the game if you have an orgasm before your partner at any time before the end.

The game is played in two separate phases, the first being softer while the second phase is played naked. Throughout the game, players may have to pick a card and do what the image on it explains. Other possible areas are 'Wine/Drinks pauses' and 'Bite the other player'.

The winner gets to dare the other player to do something he or she wants.

From the publisher's website:
The game for lovers that takes you and your partner through a dizzying array of sensuous thrills. Illustrated cards guide you through a series of sexy trials. But be careful! No matter how excited you get, you have to keep your passions in check.

The game includes: - 1 board - 4 decks of cards - 1 die - 1 hourglass - 2 tokens

boardgame.name: Pocket Battles: Confederacy vs Union
ポケットバトル：南軍 vs 北軍
boardgame.description:
A war game that fits in the pocket! In Pocket Battles: Confederacy vs Union — the fourth title in the Pocket Battles series — tiles represent troops and troops make up units in your army; just determine the size of the battle, then create your own army from a pool of existing troops. Each tile hits on certain rolls, and some can only melee while others can shoot. Some tiles also have special traits that can affect their whole unit or army.

The basic rules of the game are fairly simple: Two armies face each other in battle. The armies are split into three columns and two rows. Players must decide at the start of the game how many points they will give to their armies, which then determines how many points you must defeat to win.

On your turn, you choose which faction of your army to send off to battle! Attacks are made by using Order Tokens. If no Order Tokens are present on a unit, it costs just one token to issue orders to that unit. Issuing orders to the same unit in the same Battle Round costs you the number of tokens present on the unit, plus one. (If one token is on a unit, it costs two additional tokens to activate it again; with three tokens on the unit, it costs four additional tokens, etc.)

After a round of battle, you may choose to redeploy your units. (Units may move from the back of the row to the front of the same row, from the back of a row to the back of another row, or from the front of a row to the front of another row). Redeployment costs no Order tokens. The battle ends when one army has eliminated at least half of the points in the opposing army.

boardgame.name: Leben in Dortmund
boardgame.description:
Game published about the German City of Dortmund.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Dortmund. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

For all of 2012, the people of the world were quaking in their booties, fearing that the universe would end. (Well, okay... the gullible people of the world were quaking in their booties.)

"The Second Coming of the Millerites" (in which Steve Miller tries to cash in on doomsday fever with disastrous results) and "Apocalypse Not" (which dramatizes a theory about why the world didn't end). THE WORLD IS STILL HERE -- SO LET'S GO ON GAMING!

boardgame.name: 7 Ronin
boardgame.description:
7 Ronin is an asymmetric two-player game in which one player controls a group of ninja attacking a village that's defended by seven ronin (masterless samurai), which are controlled by the other player. The ninja player wins by occupying five of the village's ten areas, while the ronin player wins by surviving eight rounds.

Each turn starts with the players distributing their forces over the village areas simultaneously and separately. Their choices are then revealed, and combat resolved. Each of the ronin have a different special ability to aid the defender, while each of the village areas have a special ability usable by the attacker once it has been occupied.

boardgame.name: The Big Bang Theory: Rock! Paper! Scissors! Lizard! Spock! Dice Game
boardgame.description:
The Rock! Paper! Scissors! Lizard! Spock! Dice Game contains 3 red dice, 1 black die, and 24 small chips. The object is to be the last player in the game who owns a chip or chips.

Each player starts with 3 chips. A player rolls the black die and places it in the center of the table. This is the die that all players will be competing against.

The first player rolls all three red dice. The player compares their dice to the black die, and loses chips for each die that is defeated by the center black die. They also pass a chip to the player on their left for every die that instructs them to do so. For every die that matches the black die in the center, the player passes a chip to the player on their right.

When all players have had a turn, the black die is rolled again, and a new round is begun. Play continues until only one player has chips remaining.

boardgame.name: Crash
boardgame.description:
Set Up:
Place the a ring on a flat surface and put a column in each of the recesses. When each recess is occupied place another ring on top and fill in the same way. Alternate the column colours as you complete each ring. Repeat this process until all the columns have been used, you will be left with 4 spare rings.

Game Play:
- The youngest player starts the game, play then continues in a clockwise direction.
- On each go, players throw the coloured die. They then have to remove a column with the same colour as the die, from any ring except the top.
- All removed columns are replaced on the top ring of the tower, when all the recesses to the top ring are full a new ring is added.
- If the topples during a player's turn they are eliminated from the game, the tower is rebuilt and play continues with the remaining players.
- The winner of the game is the last player in play!

Objective:
The object of the game is to be the last player to skilfully remove the columns from the lower levels of the tower to the top, without making the tower topple.

Contents:
11 rings, 60 columns, game die.

boardgame.name: Bania
boardgame.description:
In a formidable Indian landscape, a burgeoning marketplace is forming. Opportunities are ripe in this community of traders, bankers, moneylenders, and dealers of grains and spices. Fortune awaits the one who plans well and uses his resources wisely. Oil, silk, incense and spices are the currency used to build tents, establish settlements, and amass riches — but commerce brings competition, and the space to build is limited. When there is no more room, the player who has maximized his resources to become the most successful merchant is the victor!

In Bania, players use resource cards to buy and build tents, then strategically place these tents on the board to earn points. When no legal moves remain on the board, the game ends and the player with the most points wins. On a turn, a player performs these actions in order, if possible:


Collect your bonus: If your elephant marker sits on a tent tile on the board, collect one resource card of each type in the settlement where the marker is located.
Buy and place tent tiles OR roll for resources: As explained below.
Place your elephant marker: If your elephant marker isn't on the board and you placed tent tiles that turn, place the marker on one tile you placed this turn.


Each player starts the game with four tent tiles and eight resource cards: two of each type (oil, spice, silk and incense); one side of the tent tiles shows one of these four resources, while the other side shows three resource symbols (e.g., two spice and one silk). If you want more resources, you can roll the four dice up to three times, locking any dice that you wish while doing so. When you stop rolling, you receive one resource card for each resource symbol showing; in addition, if you have both a front and back half of an elephant showing on the dice, then you receive an elephant marker bonus as at the start of your turn.

If you have the right cards in hand, you might instead choose to buy and place tents; if you have twelve or more cards, then you must do so. A tent costs three resource cards matching the three resource symbols on the back and you pay this cost after placing a tent on the game board, but if you place a tent adjacent to other tents, then the cost is discounted based on the colors of adjacent tents, possibly allowing you to place a tent for no cost at all! When you place a tent on its own to start a settlement, you receive 3 points; for all other tents placed, you receive 1 point each. You refill your hand to four tent tiles at the end of your turn — but if you've placed all four, you can immediately draw four new tiles and keep building!

A settlement can have at most seven tents in it; when someone places the seventh tent, any elephant markers in the settlement are removed and returned to their owners. The game ends when no more tents can be placed. Whoever placed the final tile scores 3 points, and whoever has the most of each type of resource card scores 2 points. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: EpicTable Virtual Tabletop
boardgame.description:
Easy to Use
Standard Windows interface
No-hassle networking
Share files easily — even drag from your browser onto the tabletop!
"Kitchen table" licensing

System Embracing
Any game you can play on your physical tabletop
Easy-to-use, yet robust and powerful dice roller
Play the latest indie game, your favorite OSR clone, or your own homebrew system

Like a Real Table!
Move and sort virtual dice on the tabletop - play Dogs in the Vineyard online
Index cards, tokens, virtual miniatures, and text objects
Draw on a virtual wet-erase battlemap or import your favorite map images

Philosophy
EpicTable is about keeping groups together and building new ones.

To achieve that, we believe that it's important to get out of the way—to make the virtual tabletop as fast and easy to use as your physical tabletop.

That's why we use a centralized messaging system to avoid networking configuration issues, why we handle all the transfer of images and other data for you transparently, and why we don't try to do a lot of rules automation that forces you to do a lot of prep for the sake of the tool instead of for your players and your game.

boardgame.name: George Washington Carver and the Nuts of Doom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World is slated to end, so we bring you the Final Battle (#2)!

Some believe the ancient Mayans predicted the end of the world at some point during 2012, but there's uncertainty about when during 2012 the world is going to end. Just in case, we all die early, NUELOW Games is releasing a final ROLF! product every month this year, each with its own theory as to how the end might come. Real Gamers will go out rollplaying!

And while the Mayans may have predicted the End of the World, they did not envision the nightmare that Dr. Ghoul will visit upon the Earth if he succeeds in turning the world's women into men! They could not have imagined the horror and devastation that the Power of Peanuts will create when it is used for Evil instead of Good.

But there is still hope! George Washington Carver, undisputed Master of Peanut Power, has traveled through time to 2012 to save us all!

George Washington Carver and the Nuts of Doom presents four linked Battle Scenarios tracing the development of Dr. Ghoul's evil master plan from 1922 through 1942 and to the final year of 2012. It also contains seven pre-generated characters (George Washington Carver, Jimmy Carter, Dr. Ghoul, Black Cat, Black Kitten, Peanut Brutes, and Swedish Bikini Team Members) and several Combat Manuevers and Traits for use in creating your own ROLF! characters.

Final Battles: The Mayans Predicted the End. NUELOW Games Exploits It!

boardgame.name: POTS vs. PANS
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World is Coming to An End, So Why Not Go Out Gaming?!

There are those who say that the Ancient Mayans predicted the world is going to end in 2012! We here at NUELOW Games are accepting of all beliefs--even the stupid ones--so we're producing a Final Battle product each montyh this year until the world ends, or 2013 arrives.

We hereby proudly present POTS vs. PANS: The Final Battle (#6), a full-color superhero extravaganza! (Will there be 12 Final Battles? Only the Mayans knew for sure!)

In POTS vs. PANS, the decades-long, cross-generational feude between the pure-hearted American superheroes who make up the roster of PANS (Patriotic American Native-born Superheroes) and the dastardly international league of supervillians POTS (People's Organization for Terrorism and Socialism) comes to a head. When this battle is over, one side or the other will be wiped from the face of the planet... and if PANS loses, hundreds of innocents will die in a nuclear blast.

As many as eight gamers cam play this battle scenario for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters. It features new traits, new combat maneuvers, stats and character portraits for nine pre-generated costumed heroes and villians. such as Butts Pirate & Butts Boy, tireless anti-smoking crusaders; Captain Freedom, the Gay Patriot; Texas Hellion, a feminist crusader for the Right to Bear Arms; Red Raider, dedicated foe of anti-Communist forces the world over; Spirit of the People, North Korea's Own Superhero; and Mother Eve, a mysterious mystic whose powers seem to derive from the serpent wrapped around her body.

boardgame.name: Hammerin' Tongs: A Tribute to Robert E. Howard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Ain't no galoot gonna knock out Steve Costigan without a rematch!"

Celebrated pulp-fiction writer Robert E. Howard wrote over 300 short stories in his too-short life. The character he wrote the most about was Steve Costigan, a sea-faring prizefighter with a habit of getting into trouble. It's a character who seems tailor-made for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters!

In Hammerin' Tongs: A ROLF! Tribute to Robert E. Howard, Steve Costigan crosses paths with another Howard creation--hard-bitten police detective Steve Harrison--and they join forces to beat the heck out of the Son or Erlik Kahn and his Tong Hatchet Men.

This supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters contains four pre-generated characters, three Combat Maneuvers designed to bring the feel of a Howard-written boxing tale to ROLF!, and three linked combat scenarios.

boardgame.name: The Breast Hope for Peace
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Huda thought it was possible!

A bikini model ushers in hope, change, and the possibility of world-wide peace! Her simple act of posing on the cover of a magazine brings world leaders together as never before, and a Golden Age is about to dawn on Planet Earth. Well, unless terrorist suicide bombers and Martian Special Forces don't put a stop to this digusting outbreak of peace and harmony.

ROLF!: The Breast Hope for Peace was inspired by the real-world controversy surrounding model Huda Naccache's appearance on the cover of Lilac Magazine. Written with all the insight and sensitivity displayed in The Death of Osama bin Laden and The Pimp, the Protester, and the Po-Po, Steve Miller and L.L. Hundal proudly present yet another work that informs while it entertains. (And they reveal the top secret true origins of Kim Jong Il while they're at it. Learn what the CIA and the Red Chinese don't want you to know!)

Featuring new combat maneuvers, traits, and five battle scenarios, this expansion also includes game stats for Huda the Bikini-clad Wonder herself, Barack Obama, Pope Benedict, Ayman al-Zawahiri, Chuck Norris, and five other major international figures. (And then there's the stats for Suicide Bombers and the Martian Special Forces....)
